transcript.text: [Music]
[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x22
rapport my name is Dave and this is
episode 1267 a and today's date is April
30th 2017 and the title of the episode
is the panic begins the collapse
accelerates now before I get started I
just want to make an announcement I
uploaded an interview with John Titus to
the x-22 Report spotlight YouTube
channel now he just put out a new
documentary where he describes who is
running the United States who's really
in charge so you can go over to his
YouTube channel called best evidence and
you can listen to his documentary that
you can come back and listen to the
interview with John Titus on the x-22
Report spotlight YouTube channel all you
need to do is go over to YouTube type in
X 20 to report spotlight go to that
channel you'll see the interview there
or you can come over to the X 20 to
report calm site scroll down a little
bit you'll see the interview on the
right hand side same thing with new
Sentinel scroll down a little bit look
over to your right hand side you'll see
the interview and you could play it
right on the site let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now a
couple days ago we talked about Canada's
mortgage bank and they were being bailed
out this is home Capital Group and it
looks like the panic well is it's
accelerating right and things are
actually getting worse on Friday the
company revealed that high interest rate
saving account balances fell another 36
percent to 521 million by Friday morning
down by a whopping 293 million from 814
million Thursday and more than two
billion a month ago in other words it
looks like the emergency loan the
bailout it is not working and we can see
at this point that this Bank is
completely insolvent and people are
running there to get their funds out and
what we're seeing right now is things
are rapidly breaking apart and this is
one of the first signs that we're seeing
that things are dramatically changing
we've been seeing many other indicators
but this is right out there in your face
and this reminds me of like the Bear
Stearns moment where things rapidly
changed and we're starting to see this
right now
where things are starting to rapidly
change in the environment because all
along they've been telling us how great
the housing market has been and how
great the retail market has been and how
well the economy has been doing and
we're seeing things just dramatically
change at a blink of an eye we see that
homeownership here in the United States
well it is continually falling now we
have to think to ourselves if
homeownership is continually falling who
is buying these homes what we know who
is buying these homes these are the
hedge funds investment companies foreign
investors the everyday person here in
the United States is sitting on the
sidelines saying I just don't have the
money to purchase this home and here is
the proof because the youngest age group
and this is the next generation
thirty-five and younger where they're
supposed to be going out and purchasing
homes saying I'm starting my family I'm
making a good living I have a good job
they're not doing it they are not
purchasing homes why because they don't
have the funds to do so they don't have
the job security they're not making the
money like the previous generations this
is why things are dramatically changing
now right now the homeownership rate for
American thirty-five and younger slumped
from thirty four point seven percent as
of December 2016 to thirty four point
three percent in line with the lowest
rate reported by the Census Bureau going
back nearly a quarter century this right
there is not a good situation and it's
not going to help and we've seen this in
other countries Cyprus Greece Italy
France it's the same exact pattern which
tells us that something is changing out
there and we can see at this point that
things are rapidly deteriorating and if
we look at all these different sectors
and we've been looking at all these
economic sectors things are all
contracting at the same time and then we
get the word from GDP from the
government where they put out the new
GDP number that is the worst GDP number
that we've seen and that is the
manipulation
number this tells us that things are
rapidly deteriorating and we are heading
into this downward spiral where it's
just going to get worse and worse as
time goes on these bubbles are going to
pop the economy will not be able to be
sustained and when we look at these
indicators we see that a lot of things
are going wrong all at once the weak
economic growth in the first quarter was
the continuation of a long-term trend
right now
Obama as we know was the only president
in history not to have a single year
when the US economy grew at least by
three percent and this is now the fourth
time in the last six quarters when the
economic growth has been less than 2% on
an annualized basis and we see right now
Obama while he was president was telling
us that this was the best recovery ever
and he was handing off this incredible
economy to Trump now consumer spending
which drives the US economy more than
anything else at this point most US
consumers they're completely tapped out
they have no funds left in fact CBS News
has reported that three-fourths of all
US consumers have to scramble to cover
their living costs each month the job
market appears to be slowing the US
economy only added ninety eight thousand
jobs in March and that was approximately
half of what most analysts were
expecting gee this does make sense
because how many retailers have closed
how many retails have laid off
individuals corporations or laying off
and we're continually saying this the
flow of credit appears to be slowing as
well in fact this is the first time
since the last recession when there has
been no growth for commercial and
industrial lending for at least six
months
last month US factory output dropped at
the fastest pace that we've witnessed in
more than two years and we know that
retail well that is just completely a
disaster even the corporate media called
it the retail apocalypse and of course
they try to smooth this over saying well
this is a sign that everything is moving
to online and that's why
brick-and-mortar
is doing so poorly but we know that
online sales is only a tenth of the
retail sales and what we're seeing right
now this year just the first part of
this year we see more retailers that
have declared bankruptcy than at any
other time and if we project this out
and we go throughout this entire year we
can see that we're going to see more
store closing and the default rate and
the number of bankruptcies I should say
is going to skyrocket by the end of this
year the order industry is also
experiencing a great deal of stress this
has been the worst for US automakers
since the last recession seven out of
eight largest fell short of their sales
projections in March and then when we
look at used car prices well those are
declining at a rapid rate actually
Morgan Stanley was out there and they're
projecting that used vehicle prices well
they could crash up to 50 percent over
the next several years
commercial bankruptcies they're rising
at the fastest pace since the last
recession consumer bankruptcies same
thing rising at the fastest pace since
the last recession and then we have the
student loan bubble well that's about to
burst it's reported at 27% of all
student loans all already in default and
it is getting worse now goldman sachs
was out there and they are warning that
the gap between stock investors hopes
and reality is glow is close to an
all-time high where these two things
they're heading in completely different
directions and when we look at the New
York Fed now cast that now cast included
soft data compared to the Atlanta Fed
where they were looking at the hard data
and then we have reality which is really
what the Atlanta Fed was reporting on
and these two things are completely
separate and apart and we can see right
now that as we move along the economy
it's going to continually deteriorate it
is basically contracting and imploding
on itself right now and we can see at
this point that time is tickin away here
and from
that we've been looking at and
everything that we've been tracking we
can see the pace has picked up right now
actually if we go back and we saw how
many stores were closing down it wasn't
really that many and how many
bankruptcies there were really not that
many when we look at the GDP numbers we
can see they are continually declining
because what happened was during the
last recession the Fed was able to pump
everything up just like a druggie who's
on drugs they're pumped up with drugs
they're feeling great and then they
start coming off of it and the only way
to feel good again is to pump up with
more drugs well the Fed right now even
though they're doing things covertly
they need to increase the stimulus
dramatically to pump this economy up and
we can see by them raising the interest
rates by them holding back on the
stimulus without giving the the economy
even more free money we can see they've
already started the entire destruction
of the economy and there is a battle
going on right now between the central
bank and the Trump administration on who
is going to bring this economy down
first because as you can see with Trump
right now he wants more spending he's
trying to pump up these bubbles the
central bank is doing the same exact
thing whoever is the winner will control
the narrative of how the economy
actually fell apart and who is
responsible because for example if Trump
and his administration is the winner of
bringing down the economy and is that
really a winner no but he was able to do
it he can turn around and say listen
these were all the things that the
central bank wanted us to do they wanted
more spending they wanted more free
money out there this is how they did it
they pumped up the bubbles and they are
responsible for doing all this because
they raise the interest rates during the
weakest economy ever I mean he can just
turn around and say look at the GDP why
would you raise interest rates where GDP
was what point five percent it makes no
sense why would you raise it if it's
around 0.7% why would you begin raising
it at the point they started to raise it
because we can see right now
this is what they're trying to do and
there is a race now now the fact is is
that this economy is coming down one way
or another and everyone needs to be
prepared and ready for what is going to
happen here because once the system
comes down we know from everything that
we've been looking at from the balland
documents and what they've done in other
countries basically the currency most
likely is going to disappear there's
going to be capital controls banks are
going to shut down supplies to stores
well they're not going to flow because
credit is going to freeze up and the
dollar is going to lose value very very
quickly as we see hyperinflation pour in
and we can see that many people are not
going to be prepared and ready for what
is about to happen here and they're
going to run to the stores because they
won't understand what is happening and
they realize that okay I need to get as
many supplies as possibly can because I
can see every single day that the price
of goods are going up which merely means
the dollar value is continually dropping
and we can see right now the government
is having their own problems people are
scrambling all over the country and we
can see at this point that if you were
not ready for this if you don't have
gold silver cash on hand because you'll
use that first to basically buy your
supplies until cash can no longer be
used you'll need a weapon to protect
yourself you'll need water you'll need
medical supplies you'll need toiletries
you'll need all of this type of stuff
because things are going to rapidly
change your lifestyle is going to change
everyone's going to have to hunker down
during this period and it's going to be
a shock to the system a shock to the
world and I've been saying this for
quite a while now you need to get ready
for what is about to happen here because
if you are not ready it's going to be
like a storm hitting your area and
you're saying oh I got plenty of time I
don't need batteries I don't need fresh
water I no need gas for my generator
I'll be fine it nothing's going to
happen because you know the storm is
coming but I don't believe it's coming
and I'll just wait it out and all of a
sudden the storm does hit and you are
not prepared whatsoever and all of a
sudden you have no water
you have no batteries you have no lights
you have no
as for your generator you're sitting
there going how long this is going to
last and all of a sudden one day two
days three days go by and you're like
wow this is lasting a lot longer than I
thought and things start to rapidly
deteriorate and you get nervous you get
afraid you don't want this to happen now
if you are prepared and you are ready
for this you already understand what is
about to happen you are already prepared
for what is about to happen and you know
that okay when this does happen I can
stay in my home I can lock it down and I
can protect everything that I have right
now my family and everything else and if
I have to move
I have preparations for that also so
everyone needs to be ready and prepared
for what is coming
listen everyone thanks a lot for
listening be well be safe and especially
be prepared thanks a lot
[Music]
you
